## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey there, I've been following the recent developments on the Verus blockchain. Can you tell me about the new core protocol features that were recently activated?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, I'd be happy to! Two new core protocol features were recently activated on the Verus blockchain: VerusID (NFT) Marketplace, which allows for the public and private exchange of VerusIDs, and Verus Vault, which enables users to lock funds for various purposes such as security, vesting, trusts, and inheritance.

**User:**
That sounds really interesting! I'd like to learn more about Verus Vault. What is its purpose, and how can I set it up?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus Vault is a feature that allows users to lock funds for security, vesting, trusts, inheritance, and more. You can find a tutorial on how to set up Verus Vault in the official Verus documentation or online resources. I'd be happy to help you find the resources if you need them!

**User:**
I also heard about a partnership between Arkeytyp and Digital Nation Entertainment. Can you tell me more about that?

**AI Assistant:**
The partnership between Arkeytyp and Digital Nation Entertainment is significant because Digital Nation Entertainment has committed to exclusively working with Verus on the blockchain side of their metaverse environments. This partnership aims to bring the metaverse into people's lives and marks the beginning of a combined effort between Verus, Arkeytyp, and Digital Nation Entertainment.

**User:**
That's really cool! What is the role of Arkeytyp in the Verus ecosystem, and what do they do with the proceeds from their partnership with Digital Nation Entertainment?

**AI Assistant:**
Arkeytyp is a Verus ecosystem company that has partnered with Digital Nation Entertainment to create high-quality digital worlds. As part of this partnership, Arkeytyp donates 50% of the proceeds to the Verus Coin Foundation.
What are the new core protocol features that were recently activated on the Verus blockchain?

Two new core protocol features were recently activated on the Verus blockchain: VerusID (NFT) Marketplace, which allows for the public and private exchange of VerusIDs, and Verus Vault, which enables users to lock funds for various purposes such as security, vesting, trusts, and inheritance.

Title: November 2021 — Verus Monthly Recap
Article URL: https://medium.com/veruscoin/november-2021-verus-monthly-recap-f2406382e542
Content:November 2021 — Verus Monthly Recap
The latest Verus updates on development, community, ecosystem and more. Subscribe to the newsletter here.Next to the monthly recap on Medium, you can receive the exact same content through a newsletter. Subscribe here. I’ll keep things short and to the point.
Successful Mainnet Upgrade!
On Monday 29 November two new core protocol features successfully activated on the Verus blockchain. You can now use VerusID (NFT) Marketplace to exchange VerusIDs publicly and privately. And use Verus Vault to lock funds for security, vesting, trusts, inheritance, and more. [read full article here]. To ensure smooth operations, please update your wallet as soon as possible [download here].
🔒 ℹ️ Learn how to set up Verus Vault [read tutorial here].
Exclusive Partnership Digital Nation Entertainment
Verus ecosystem company Arkeytyp signed an agreement with Digital Nation Entertainment concerning the creation of high-quality digital worlds. Digital Nation Entertainment has committed to exclusively working with Verus on the blockchain side of their metaverse environments. Arkeytyp donates 50% of the proceeds from this relationship to the Verus Coin Foundation.
Earlier this month Digital Nation Entertainment released a digital environment for the movie The Harder They Fall (on Netflix) and the Verus community helped with the testing of this metaverse. This exclusive and exciting partnership with Verus, Arkeytyp and Digital Nation Entertainment is the beginning of a combined effort to bring the metaverse into people’s lives.
What is the purpose of Verus Vault, and how can I learn more about setting it up?

Verus Vault is a feature that allows users to lock funds for security, vesting, trusts, inheritance, and more. You can find a tutorial on how to set up Verus Vault in the official Verus documentation or online resources.
